translated: Twenty-one Praises and Homages to the Buddha-Mother Who Saves and Liberates

I pay homage to the holy AvalokiteÅ›vara Bodhisattva of the great treasury of compassion.
The supreme realm of PadmarÄja, born from the green syllable taá¹ƒ,
The mother of the karma of the buddhas of the three times, with immeasurable light adorning the crown.
The crown of the gods and asuras is adorned, respectfully kneeling and holding the lotus of the two feet.
The mother who saves from all suffering, I pay homage before the Buddha-Mother who saves and liberates.
Oá¹ƒ, I pay homage to the holy revered mother who saves and liberates.
Oá¹ƒ, I pay homage to TÄrÄ, the swift and courageous one, to TÄrÄ who removes fear.
TÄrÄ is able to bestow all supreme meanings, I praise and pay homage to the one endowed with the syllable svÄhÄ.
I pay homage to the mother who saves and liberates, the swift and courageous one, whose eyes shine like the lightning of a moment.
The lotus face of the honored one of the three worlds, appearing majestic from the wondrous lotus.
I pay homage to the mother of the hundred-year-old bright moon, whose round and illuminating face is free from defilements.
Like a thousand stars gathered together at once, your supreme majestic radiance surpasses them all.
I pay homage to the mother of purple gold color, with the marvelous lotus hand, and excellent adornments.
You bestow diligence, skillful means, tranquility, patience, meditative concentration, and the nature free from objects.
I pay homage to the mother of the Buddha's crown, who is supreme in fulfilling boundless practices.
Your virtues reach the other shore, leaving nothing behind, and you are most beloved by the victorious Buddha's disciples.
I pay homage to the syllable tarahum, whose sound fills the directions and the entire sky.
With your feet, you tread upon the seven worlds, and you are able to summon and subdue all without exception.
I pay homage to the mother of Indra, Brahma, Agni, and the wind gods, with the assembly of self-existing ones gathered.
The bhutas, zombies, gandharvas, and other yaksha multitudes sing your praises.
I pay homage to the mother of the trishula, who utterly destroys the harmful actions of others.
With the left leg extended and the right leg bent, you trample with your feet, and your blazing crown protrudes, shining with utmost brilliance.
Homage to TÄrÄ, the great and tight mother, courageous and able to crush the classes of enemies and demons.
On the lotus face, she makes a frowning brow, destroying all the hosts of enemies.
Homage to the mother of the three jewels' strict seal, the fingers at the heart with a majestic appearance.
Adorning the square wheel to the end without remainder, the body's blazing mass of light seeds.
Homage to the mother of majestic virtue and joy, adorned with jewel light, pearl garlands, and various lights.
The utmost joyful laughter, TÄrÄ, subduing the worldly demons and making them submit.
Homage to the mother who guards the multitudes of lands, and is also able to summon the multitudes of gods.
Shaking the frowning face, with the syllable hÅ«á¹ƒ, liberating all misfortunes and failures.
Homage to the mother whose crown is marked with the moon, with a magnificent and wondrous light appearing in the crown.
AmitÄbha Buddha appears in the topknot, always emitting various wondrous jewel lights.
Homage to the mother who is like the fire at the end of the eon, dwelling in the blazing topknot.
Sitting in half-lotus posture, universally delighted, able to destroy the wheel of evil enemies.
I pay homage to the mother who presses her hand on the earth, trampling with her feet, suppressing.
Manifesting a frowning face, making the sound hum, able to break through the seven dangers and subdue.
I pay homage to the mother of peace and gentleness, the realm of nirvana, tranquility, and supreme bliss.
Accompanied by the seed syllable sha ha, skillfully able to eliminate great calamities and misfortunes.
I pay homage to the mother of universal great joy, causing the limbs and body of all enemies to be freed.
Arranged with the ten-syllable mantra, the bright mantra sound of hum always shining.
I pay homage to the mother of turi bha ti, with the seed syllable hum on the foot, in the shape of a trampling gesture.
Mila manda khyed la sa, able to shake in these three places.
I pay homage to the mother of the ocean of the gods of the sky, holding the image of a divine beast in her hand.
Reciting the two taras, making the sound of ha, able to eliminate all poisons without remainder.
Homage to the mother of the assembly of gods, loved by the celestial kinnaras.
With majestic joy like firm armor, she eliminates quarrels, evil dreams, and so on.
Homage to the mother of the sun and moon, vast and round, her eyes surpass the universal illumination.
Reciting the two syllables hara and dhatri, she skillfully removes evil poisons and epidemic fevers.
Homage to the mother endowed with the three realities, with excellent quiescence and power all complete.
Yakshas, rakshasas, vetalas, and dharanis - she removes calamities and misfortunes to the utmost.
If a wise one diligently recites this twenty-one times with utmost sincerity,ğŸ”½The one who is saved will sincerely pay homage to the root mantra.
Therefore, praise the root mantra.
Every morning upon rising and in the evening, recall and bestow the supreme fearlessness.
All misdeeds will be completely eliminated, and one will be able to transcend all evil destinies.
These will quickly attain wisdom and be consecrated by the 70 million buddhas.
In the present life, wealthy, noble, long-lived, and secure, in the future, heading towards the stage of the buddhas.
Sometimes mistakenly ingesting various poisonous substances, either naturally occurring or artificially created,
Recalling the true power of the holy venerable one, all evil poisons and drugs are completely eliminated.
If one sees others afflicted by ghosts and spirits, or suffering from fever and various pains,
If one recites this praise two, three, or seven times, all their sufferings and afflictions will be completely removed.
If one wishes for sons or daughters, one will obtain sons or daughters; if one seeks wealth, treasures, or status, one will attain riches.
One will be able to perfectly fulfill one's wishes, and all obstacles will be unable to invade.
The holy venerable mother, the savior Tara, and all the buddhas of the ten directions and three times,
As well as their disciples, I now single-mindedly respectfully praise and pay homage.
Flowers, incense, lamps, candles, fragrant water, delicious food, music, and other offerings,
Actually presented, appearing in one's mind, I wish that all the sages will joyfully accept them.
From beginningless time up to the present, the ten unwholesome deeds and the five heinous crimes
Are all due to the afflictions of the mind, and I repent of all the evil deeds I have committed.ğŸ”½The Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas,
And even ordinary sentient beings,ğŸ”½All the blessings and virtues accumulated in the three times,
I rejoice in them all without exception.ğŸ”½In accordance with the various wishes of sentient beings,
With their various kinds of discriminating wisdom,ğŸ”½In accordance with their greater, lesser, and middling capacities,
I exhort them to turn the wheel of the wonderful Dharma.ğŸ”½From now until the end of saá¹ƒsÄra,
I request that you always abide in the world and not enter nirvÄá¹‡a.ğŸ”½For the sake of all sentient beings in the ocean of suffering,
I pray that the Holy Mother will look upon them with eyes of compassion.ğŸ”½All the blessings and virtues I have accumulated,
I dedicate them all as causes for supreme enlightenment.ğŸ”½I pray that before long, you will attain
The unsurpassed guide among sentient beings.ğŸ”½The venerable and holy Buddha-mother endowed with great compassion,
For all of us sentient beings,
May they attain the realization of enlightenment.ğŸ”½Until the stage of unsurpassed enlightenment,
May they attain constant bliss in all lives.ğŸ”½In all places of cultivating enlightenment,
May all interrupted demonic disturbances,ğŸ”½All illnesses, all heavenly life-spans,
And all evil dreams and inauspicious signs,ğŸ”½The eight fears and all afflictions and harmful things,
May they quickly be eliminated.ğŸ”½In the mundane and supramundane,
May all wholesome happiness and abundance,ğŸ”½And all flourishing beneficial things,
May they be naturally accomplished.ğŸ”½Vigorously cultivating the flourishing Dharma,
Cultivating you will always see the holy countenance.ğŸ”½Entering the meaning of emptiness and the intention of enlightenment,
May it temporarily increase like the waxing moon.ğŸ”½That Buddha's assembly is all pure,
I will then be born from the supreme lotus flower,ğŸ”½Personally behold the TathÄgata's immeasurable light,
And receive my prediction of enlightenment in the present.
I follow the Buddha's cultivation in the world, the mother of the buddhas' karma in the three times.
One face, two arms, green body, wishing to hold an upavÃ¢ flower, auspicious.
How is the subtle body of the Buddha's mother, and the lifespan of the retinue?
What are the realms and names? May we all be the same.
The power of the little merit of praising and celebrating you, wherever we are in the directions,
May all illnesses, demons, poverty, and disputes be eliminated, and may auspiciousness increase and be granted.
Paying homage and making offerings to the mother of the world-honored one, with the accumulated goodness
All sentient beings in the world will be born in the Land of Ultimate Bliss.
Abandoning the body surpasses the adornment of excellent characteristics, abandoning speech surpasses attaining the voice of a kalaviá¹…ka bird,
Abandoning the mind surpasses realizing omniscience, accomplishing the auspicious and meritorious auspiciousness.
The twenty-one praises and praises of the holy savior and mother of the buddhas are completed.
